articles.title: Malian PM Supports DPRK's Reunification Efforts
articles.content:
Malian PM Supports DPRK's Reunification Efforts 
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Malian government fully supports the government and people of the DPRK in their efforts to defend the system and national sovereignty and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, stated Malian Prime Minister Ousmane Issoufi Maiga.
 He met a DPRK government economic delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man in Bamako on June 27 upon authorization by Malian President Amadou Toumani Toure.    
 The prime minister said President Kim Il Sung rendered assistance, material and moral, to Mali after its independence.

Greetings to Venezuelan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Venezuelan President
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias on the occasion of its independence day. 
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, the message  sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cape Verde
    Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Pedro Pires, president of Cape Verde, on July 1 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the independence and the proclamation of the Republic of Cape Verde.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Cape Verde will grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president a great success in his responsible work for prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.
